page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: THE LAND IS MAINLY FLAT WITH SOME AREAS OF UNDULATING LAND.THE MAIN IMPRESSION OF THE LAND USE IS THAT THERE IS MOSTLY CEREAL AND ARABLE USE WITH A LITTLE BIT OF MARKET GARDENING IN THE SOUTH-WEST CORNER.THERE WAS ALSO SOME LIVESTOCK.THE POPULATION IN THE AREA IS VERY SPARSE AND THERE ARE NOT MANY BUILDINGS.THE FEW THAT THERE WERE,WERE MAINLY BY THE CROSSROADS AND THE SHOPS,MOST OF THEM ARE ON THE MAIN ROAD TO CLACTON.AS AN EFFECT OF THE HOLIDAY TRAFFIC THERE ARE AN EXTRA COUPLE IF GARAGES TO WHAT WOULD NORMALLY BE THERE.ALSO THERE ARE MORE PUBS IN THE AREA BY THE ROADS.WITH ALL THE HOLIDAY TRAFFIC GOING DOWN TO THE COAST THEY HAD TO BUILD THE NEW ROAD TO RELIEVE THE TRAFFIC.THE FEW AMENITIES ARE-GARAGES,PUBLIC HOUSES,POST-OFFICES AND THREE RIDING SCHOOLS WHICH SHOW THE WEALTH OF THE
